title: Texas Man Charged Under New Anti-Doping Law for Allegedly Providing Drugs to Tokyo Olympic Athletes
sub_head: Charges are first under the Rodchenkov Anti-Doping Act, which became law in December 2020
body:
In the first test of a new anti-doping law, an El Paso, Texas, man was charged in a scheme to provide banned performance-enhancing drugs to athletes in the run-up to the Olympic Games in Tokyo, according to a criminal complaint unsealed in federal court Wednesday.
Eric Lira faces two criminal counts for international sports doping and for a conspiracy to misbrand drugs, the complaint says. He was taken into custody in Texas on Wednesday, according to the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office in Manhattan, which brought the charges.
